Support the WATER Institute

Previous Events

2023 SLU Summit for Water: Water Research to Build Community Resilience

5/12/2023 - Annual water research conference hosted by SLU's WATER Institute.

2022 SLU Summit for Water: Water Resources in a Changing Climate

3/22-23/2022 - Annual water research conference hosted by SLU's WATER Institute.

2021 SLU Summit for Water: Navigating the Currents of Water Research

3/21/2021 - Join the WATER Institute at SLU for a virtual one-day summit highlighting exciting research and exploring regional water priorities.

Making Waves: SLU's New WATER Institute

6/25/2021 - A virtual event celebrating one year, including a virtual tour of the new WATER Institute labs.

Parks College Weekly Webinar Series: The WATER Institute

11/12/2020 - Explore brand new lab spaces and hear about the world-changing work faculty and students are conducting at the WATER Institute.

Social Justice Aspects of Flood Protection

10/28/2020 - A webinar featuring a panel discussion regarding the challenges of protecting communities from floods using a social justice lens.

Imagine a Day Without Water

10/21/2020 - SLU students, staff and faculty reflect on the value of water in their everyday life in short videos.

Virtual Night at the Aquarium

9/25/2020 - Learn about aquatic ecosystems and water conservation while exploring exhibits and meeting animal stars at the St. Louis Aquarium at Union Station.

Flood Mitigation and Response in the St. Louis Region

8/26/2020 - A webinar featuring regional experts discussing flood mitigation, response and nature-based solutions.

The Role of Water During COVID-19

7/15/2020 - A webinar featuring regional leaders as they discuss the role of water during COVID-19.

In the News

Scientists find microplastics in a St. Louis cave that has been closed to the public for 30 years

10/2/2023 - St. Louis Public Radio interviews WATER Institute Associate Director Liz Hasenmueller, Ph.D., about her research findings about microplastics in cave water and sediment.

Microplastics Now Invade Missouri Cave Untouched by Human Visitors for 30 Years

9/30/2023 - Tech Times reports on WATER Institute Associate Director Liz Hasenmueller, Ph.D.'s research findings about microplastics in cave water and sediment.

Scientists Found Microplastics Deep Inside a Cave Closed to the Public for Decades

9/28/2023 - Vice Media discusses research findings about microplastics in cave water and sediment with WATER Institute Associate Director Liz Hasenmueller, Ph.D.

Microplastics are found in cave water and sediment: In spite of isolation, Missouri caves show human impact

9/27/2023 - Science Daily interviews WATER Institute Associate Director Liz Hasenmueller, Ph.D., about her research findings about microplastics in cave water and sediment.

Is a water crisis around the corner for the city of St. Louis?

9/5/2023 - WATER Institute Primary Investigator Jason Knouft, Ph.D., discusses the potential for a water crisis in St. Louis following the CNN article.
